FacilityName: Morehead Utility Plant Board Water Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A conventional rapid sand filtration plant, employing a quick mix, flocculation, sedimentation, and filtration with Pre and Post chlorinaton . Chlorine gas is used for disinfection in the water treatment plant. Quantities handled or stored consist of three 2000 lb. pressurized cylinders with maximum quantity 6000 lbs. The chlorine is furnished by Vopak Cinicinnati, Cincinnati, Ohio. The product is transferred along I 64 to 801 south to US 60 then east to Airport Road to the water treatment plant. The chlorine is normally shipped in 1-ton cylinders aboard a tractor-trailer or tandem truck.
                      Worst-case release scenarios would be gas release of 2000 lbs. at a release rate of 850 lbs/min.with duration time of 10.0 minutes. Wiith a wind speed of 1.5 m/sec with a distance to endpoint of 5 miles with an estimated residential population within distance to endpoint of 300. Protective actions to be taken will be decided by local officials. The response  time to an incident at this facility  by police,fire and an ambulance should not be over 10 minutes. A evacuation radius of 10 miles was determined through the use of the EPA's Technical Guidance for Hazard Analysis based upon the release of a one -ton cylinder of gaseous chlorine. If necessary police department will use cable override system, to alert the effected area. The evacuation routes will be US 60 east and west, 519 south, 801 north, and 32 north.
                       Saint Claire Medical Center has the capability of removing contaminants-chlorine-by flushing eyes and washing the contaminated skin area as well as treatment for victims that may have gotten the chemical into their bodies by inhalation.
                       The alternative release scenarios would be a pipe leak at release rate 1.0 lbs/min. release duration would be 60.0 minutes. With a wind speed of 1.5 m/sec. with the distance to endpoint of 5 miles and with estimated residential population of 300 within th

e distance of the endpoint. They will be advised to go indoors, close all windows and vents to the outside of the buildings. Turn off air conditioners and fans, refrain from using clothes dryers and to fill cracks where outside air may enter. This is for a short duration time. If chemical is of a long duration time, then there would be a evacuation of the affected area. The reason for ordering the evacuation is that the air exchange within a house/facility would cause the air inside to become as toxic or contaminated as the  outside air. Evacuation of threatened areas will be conducted in conformance with Annex EE to this EOP.                                                                                     
         SAFETY:  Safety information includes information pertaining to the hazards of the regulated substances used or produced by our process, the technology of the process, and the equipment in the process.
        CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY : A hazmat team is being formed with the help of Rowan LEPC                                                                                                                                                                                           OPERATING PROCEDURES :  Water Treatment Plant has developed and implemented written operating procedures that provide clear instructions for safely conducting activities involved in each covered process that are consistent with the process safety information.    
                          TRAINING :  The training program covers initial training for each employee involved in operating a process that emphasizes specific safety and health hazards, emergency operations including shutdown and safe work practices. We have a continuous training program which are held every year. All Water Plant employee's attending will sign a training sheet to document who has attended.
                           MAINTENANCE :  The Water Plant maintenance man performs routine maintenance on the Chlorin

ators and alarm system. He is trained and thoroughly familiar with the entire contents of the Chlorinator manual and the routine maintenance that is to be performed. Once a year, trained qualified personnel for Chlorination Co. Inc. inspects and does any preventive  maintenance or repairs needed to keep Chlorinator operating safely.
                            COMPLIANCE AUDITS :  A compliance audit is done once a year to evaluate whether the plant is in compliance with the RMP.
                            FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY : The Water Plant has not had an accidental release in the last five years.                                                                                                                                       
                            The Water Plant has a management system that oversees implementation of the risk management program elements. Danny Caudill, plant superintendent has the overall responsibility to develop implement, and intergration of the risk management program elements. This will insure that the plant is operated and maintained in a safe manner and that it is in compliance with state, and federal regulations.
